sols_html:
Strong mathematical induction is a method to prove a statement S(n) is true for all natural numbers n. It is given by the following.

Suppose that for every natural number n, that we have the implication

\[\begin{aligned} \big(\forall\,k < n, S(k)\big) \Rightarrow S(n)\end{aligned}\]

Then for every natural number n, the statement S(n) is true.
